pli-tv-kd11:10.1.98.1: “A monk who has had a legal procedure of demotion done against himself should conduct himself properly.

pli-tv-kd11:13.1.1: At one time Assaji and Punabbasuka were the resident monks at Kīṭāgiri. They were bad and shameless.
pli-tv-kd11:13.1.2: They were misbehaving in this way:
pli-tv-kd11:13.1.3: They planted flowering trees, watered and plucked them, and then tied the flowers together. They made the flowers into garlands, garlands with stalks on one side and garlands with stalks on both sides. They made flower arrangements, wreaths, ornaments for the head, ornaments for the ears, and ornaments for the chest. And they had others do the same.
pli-tv-kd11:13.1.4: They then took these things, or sent them, to the women, the daughters, the girls, the daughters-in-law, and the female slaves of good families.
pli-tv-kd11:13.1.5: They ate from the same plates as these women and drank from the same vessels. They sat on the same seats as them, and they lay down on the same beds, on the same sheets, under the same covers, both on the same sheets and under the same covers. They ate at the wrong time, drank alcohol, and wore garlands, perfumes, and cosmetics. They danced, sang, played instruments, and performed.
pli-tv-kd11:13.1.6: While the women were dancing, singing, playing instruments, and performing, so would they.
pli-tv-kd11:13.2.1: They played various games: board games with eight and ten rows, imaginary board games, hopscotch, spillikins, dice games, tip-cat, painting-with-the-hand games, ball games, toy-pipe games, toy-plow games, turning somersaults, toy-windmill games, toy-measure games, toy-carriage games, toy-bow games, letter-guessing games, thought-guessing games, games of mimicking deformities.
pli-tv-kd11:13.2.2: They trained in elephant riding, in horsemanship, in carriage riding, in archery, in swordsmanship.
pli-tv-kd11:13.2.3: And they ran in front of elephants, in front of horses, and in front of carriages, and they ran backwards and forwards.
pli-tv-kd11:13.2.4: They whistled, clapped their hands, wrestled, and boxed.
pli-tv-kd11:13.2.5: They spread their outer robe on a stage and said to the dancing girls,
pli-tv-kd11:13.2.7: and they made gestures of approval.
pli-tv-kd11:13.2.8: And they misbehaved in a variety of ways.
pli-tv-kd11:13.3.1: Just then a certain monk who had completed the rains residence in Kāsī was on his way to visit the Buddha at Sāvatthī when he arrived at Kīṭāgiri.
pli-tv-kd11:13.3.2: In the morning he robed up, took his bowl and robe, and entered Kīṭāgiri to collect almsfood. He was pleasing in the way he entered and returned, in looking at and in looking away, in bending and stretching out his arms; his eyes were lowered, and he was perfect in deportment.
pli-tv-kd11:13.3.3: When people saw him, they said,
pli-tv-kd11:13.3.4: “Who is this, acting like a fool, like a dullard, continuously frowning?
pli-tv-kd11:13.3.5: Who will give almsfood to him?
pli-tv-kd11:13.3.6: Almsfood should instead be given to our Venerables Assaji and Punabbasuka, for they are gentle, congenial, pleasant to speak with, greeting one with a smile, welcoming, friendly, open, the first to speak.”
pli-tv-kd11:13.3.8: A certain lay follower saw that monk walking for alms in Kīṭāgiri.
pli-tv-kd11:13.3.9: He approached him, bowed, and said,
pli-tv-kd11:13.4.1: He took that monk to his house and gave him a meal.
pli-tv-kd11:13.4.3: “I’m going to Sāvatthī to visit the Buddha.”
pli-tv-kd11:13.4.4: “Well then, would you please pay respect at the feet of the Buddha in my name and say,
pli-tv-kd11:13.4.5: ‘Venerable Sir, the monastery in Kīṭāgiri has been corrupted.
pli-tv-kd11:13.4.6: The bad and shameless monks Assaji and Punabbasuka are staying there.
pli-tv-kd11:13.4.8: They plant flowering trees, water them …
pli-tv-kd11:13.4.21: And they misbehave in a variety of ways.
pli-tv-kd11:13.4.22: Those people who previously had faith and confidence have now lost it,
pli-tv-kd11:13.4.23: and there is no longer any support for the Sangha.
pli-tv-kd11:13.4.24: The good monks have left and the bad monks are staying on.
pli-tv-kd11:13.4.25: Please send monks to stay at the monastery in Kīṭāgiri.’”
pli-tv-kd11:13.5.1: The monk consented, got up, and left for Sāvatthī.
pli-tv-kd11:13.5.2: When he eventually arrived at Sāvatthī, he went to the Buddha in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery. He bowed to the Buddha and sat down.
pli-tv-kd11:13.5.3: Since it is the custom for Buddhas to greet newly arrived monks,

pli-tv-kd11:13.5.30: and finished by saying, “That’s where I’ve come from.”

pli-tv-kd11:18.1.1: At one time Venerable Sudhamma was the resident monk at the householder Citta’s monastery at Macchikāsaṇḍa. He was in charge of the building work and received a regular supply of food.
pli-tv-kd11:18.1.2: When Citta wanted to invite the Sangha, a group of monks, or an individual monk, he would not do so without getting permission from Sudhamma.
pli-tv-kd11:18.1.3: On one occasion a number of senior monks—Venerable Sāriputta, Venerable Mahāmoggallāna, Venerable Mahākaccāna, Venerable Mahākoṭṭhika, Venerable Mahākappina, Venerable Mahācunda, Venerable Anuruddha, Venerable Revata, Venerable Upāli, Venerable Ānanda, Venerable Rāhula—were wandering in Kāsī, when they arrived at Macchikāsaṇḍa.
pli-tv-kd11:18.1.4: When Citta heard that they had arrived,
pli-tv-kd11:18.1.5: he went to them, bowed, and sat down.
pli-tv-kd11:18.1.6: After Sāriputta had instructed, inspired, and gladdened Citta with a teaching,
pli-tv-kd11:18.1.8: “Venerables, please accept a meal for new arrivals from me tomorrow.”
pli-tv-kd11:18.1.9: And they accepted by remaining silent.
pli-tv-kd11:18.2.1: When he knew that they had accepted, Citta got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated them with his right side toward them, and went to Sudhamma. He bowed to him
pli-tv-kd11:18.2.3: “Venerable, please accept tomorrow’s meal from me together with the senior monks.”
pli-tv-kd11:18.2.5: “Previously when Citta wanted to invite the Sangha, a group of monks, or an individual monk, he would not do so without getting permission from me.
pli-tv-kd11:18.2.6: But now he has invited the senior monks without my permission.
pli-tv-kd11:18.2.7: He’s been corrupted, this Citta. He’s uninterested and has no affection for me.” He said to Citta,
pli-tv-kd11:18.2.14: “What difference does it make to me whether Sudhamma accepts or not?” He then bowed down, circumambulated Sudhamma with his right side toward him, and left.
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.1: The following morning Citta prepared various kinds of fine food for the senior monks.
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.3: “Let me go and see what Citta has prepared for the senior monks.” He then robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to Citta’s house, where he sat down on a prepared seat.
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.4: Citta approached Sudhamma, bowed, and sat down.
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.6: “You have prepared many kinds of fine food.
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.7: But there’s one that’s missing: sesame cookies.”
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.8: “When there are so many jewels in the word of the Buddha, Sir, you speak of sesame cookies.
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.9: Formerly there were some traders from the south who went to an eastern country to trade.
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.10: From there they brought back a hen.
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.11: That hen mated with a crow
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.12: and because of that she had a chick.
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.13: When that chick wanted to caw like a crow, it cried, ‘caw-ca-doodle-doo.’
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.14: And when that chick wanted to crow like a rooster, it cried, ‘cock-a-doodle-caw.’
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.15: In the same way, when there are so many jewels in the word of the Buddha, you speak of sesame cookies.”
pli-tv-kd11:18.4.6: I’ll do my best to supply you with robes, almsfood, a dwelling, and medicines.”
pli-tv-kd11:18.4.7: Sudhamma repeated what he had said a second time and Citta responded as before.
pli-tv-kd11:18.4.8: When Sudhamma repeated it a third time,
pli-tv-kd11:18.4.12: “I’ll go to Sāvatthī to visit the Buddha.”
pli-tv-kd11:18.4.13: “Well then, please tell the Buddha of our entire conversation.
pli-tv-kd11:18.4.14: And I would not be surprised if you returned to Macchikāsaṇḍa.”
pli-tv-kd11:18.5.1: Sudhamma put his dwelling in order, took his bowl and robe, and left for Sāvatthī.
pli-tv-kd11:18.5.2: When he eventually arrived, he went to the Buddha in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery. He bowed to the Buddha, sat down,
pli-tv-kd11:18.5.3: and told him about the conversation he had had with Citta.
pli-tv-kd11:18.5.5: “It’s not suitable, foolish man, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of an ascetic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.
pli-tv-kd11:18.5.6: How can you demean and insult Citta, who has faith and confidence, who is a donor and benefactor, and a supporter of the Sangha?
pli-tv-kd11:18.5.7: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …” …
pli-tv-kd11:18.5.9: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-kd11:18.5.10: “Well then, do a legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma,
pli-tv-kd11:18.5.11: instructing him to ask Citta for forgiveness.
pli-tv-kd11:18.6.1: And it should be done like this.

pli-tv-kd11:18.6.3: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.0: The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.1: “When a legal procedure of reconciliation has three qualities, it is illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.2: it is done in the absence of the accused, it is done without questioning the accused, it is done without the admission of the accused.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.4: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.5: it is done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it is done against one who has committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it is done against one who has confessed their offense.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.6: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having accused the person of their offense, it is done without having reminded the person of their offense, it is done without having charged the person with their offense.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.7: “When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done in the absence of the accused, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.8: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without questioning the accused, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.9: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without the admission of the accused, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.10: “When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.11: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done against one who has committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.12: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done against one who has confessed their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.13: “When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having accused the person of their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.14: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having reminded the person of their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.15: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.17: The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures of reconciliation is finished.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.18.0: The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.18.1: “When a legal procedure of reconciliation has three qualities, it is legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved:
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.19: it is done in the presence of the accused, it is done with the questioning of the accused, it is done with the admission of the accused.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.21: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved:
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.22: it is done against one who has committed an offense, it is done against one who has committed an offense that is clearable by confession, it is done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.23: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having accused the person of their offense, it is done after having reminded the person of their offense, it is done after having charged the person with their offense.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.24: “When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done in the presence of the accused, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.25: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done with the questioning of the accused, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.26: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done with the admission of the accused, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.27: “When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done against one who has committed an offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.28: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done against one who has committed an offense that is clearable by confession, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.29: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.30: “When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having accused the person of their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.31: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having reminded the person of their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.32: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having charged the person with their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.”
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.34: The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures of reconciliation is finished.
pli-tv-kd11:20.1.0: The group of four on wishing
pli-tv-kd11:20.1.1: “When a monk has five qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of reconciliation against him:
pli-tv-kd11:20.1.2: he is trying to stop householders from acquiring material gain; he is trying to harm householders; he is trying to get householders to lose their place of residence; he abuses and reviles householders; he causes division between householders.
pli-tv-kd11:20.1.4: When a monk has another five qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of reconciliation against him:
pli-tv-kd11:20.1.5: he disparages the Buddha to householders; he disparages the Teaching to householders; he disparages the Sangha to householders; he demeans and insults householders; he doesn’t fulfill legitimate promises to householders.
pli-tv-kd11:20.1.7: “The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of reconciliation against five kinds of monks:
pli-tv-kd11:20.1.8: those who are trying to stop householders from acquiring material gain; those who are trying to harm householders; those who are trying to get householders to lose their place of residence; those who abuse and revile householders; those who cause division between householders.
pli-tv-kd11:20.1.10: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of reconciliation against another five kinds of monks:
pli-tv-kd11:20.1.11: those who disparage the Buddha to householders; those who disparage the Teaching to householders; those who disparage the Sangha to householders; those who demean and insult householders; those who don’t fulfill legitimate promises to householders.”
pli-tv-kd11:20.1.13: The group of four on wishing is finished.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.1: “A monk who has had a legal procedure of reconciliation done against himself should conduct himself properly.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.3: He should not give the full ordination.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.4: He should not give formal support.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.5: He should not have a novice monk attend on him.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.6: He should not accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.7: Even if appointed, he should not instruct the nuns.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.8: He should not commit the same offense as the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.9: He should not commit an offense similar to the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.10: He should not commit an offense worse than the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.11: He should not criticize the procedure.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.12: He should not criticize those who did the procedure.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.13: He should not cancel the observance-day procedure of a regular monk.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.14: He should not cancel the invitation procedure of a regular monk.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.15: He should not speak to a regular monk to initiate a legal process against him.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.16: He should not make accusations against a regular monk.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.17: He should not ask a regular monk for permission to accuse him of an offense.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.18: He should not accuse a regular monk of an offense.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.19: He should not remind a regular monk of an offense.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.20: He should not associate inappropriately with other monks.”
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.21: The eighteen kinds of conduct in regard to the legal procedure of reconciliation are finished.
pli-tv-kd11:22.1.1: Soon afterwards the Sangha did a legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma,
pli-tv-kd11:22.1.2: instructing him to ask Citta for forgiveness.
pli-tv-kd11:22.1.3: He went to Macchikāsaṇḍa, but feeling humiliated, he was unable to ask Citta for forgiveness.
pli-tv-kd11:22.1.6: if he had asked Citta for forgiveness,
pli-tv-kd11:22.1.7: and he told them what had happened.
pli-tv-kd11:22.1.8: The monks told the Buddha. He had the monks gathered and said,
pli-tv-kd11:22.2.1: “Well then, the Sangha should give a companion messenger to Sudhamma
pli-tv-kd11:22.2.3: And this is how the messenger should be given.
pli-tv-kd11:22.2.4: First you should ask a monk, and then a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:
pli-tv-kd11:22.2.5: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-kd11:22.2.6: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should give monk so-and-so to Sudhamma as a companion messenger to ask Citta for forgiveness.
pli-tv-kd11:22.2.8: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-kd11:22.2.9: The Sangha gives monk so-and-so to Sudhamma as a companion messenger to ask Citta for forgiveness.
pli-tv-kd11:22.2.10: Any monk who approves of giving monk so-and-so to Sudhamma as a companion messenger to ask Citta for forgiveness should remain silent.
pli-tv-kd11:22.2.11: Any monk who does not approve should speak up.
pli-tv-kd11:22.2.12: The Sangha has given monk so-and-so to Sudhamma as a companion messenger to ask Citta for forgiveness.
pli-tv-kd11:22.2.13: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’
pli-tv-kd11:22.3.1: “Sudhamma should now go to Macchikāsaṇḍa with that monk as a companion messenger to ask Citta for forgiveness, saying,
pli-tv-kd11:22.3.2: ‘Please forgive me, householder; I wish to reconcile with you.’
pli-tv-kd11:22.3.3: If he forgives, all is well.
pli-tv-kd11:22.3.4: If not, the companion messenger should say,
pli-tv-kd11:22.3.5: ‘Please forgive this monk, householder; he wishes to reconcile with you.’
pli-tv-kd11:22.3.6: If he forgives, all is well.
pli-tv-kd11:22.3.7: If not, the companion messenger should say,
pli-tv-kd11:22.3.8: ‘Please forgive this monk, householder; I wish to reconcile with you.’
pli-tv-kd11:22.3.9: If he forgives, all is well.
pli-tv-kd11:22.3.10: If not, the companion messenger should say,
pli-tv-kd11:22.3.11: ‘Please forgive this monk, householder; I ask in the name of the Sangha.’
pli-tv-kd11:22.3.12: If he forgives, all is well.
pli-tv-kd11:22.3.13: If not, then within sight and hearing of Citta, the monk Sudhamma should put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and confess that offense.”
pli-tv-kd11:23.1.1: Soon afterwards Sudhamma went to Macchikāsaṇḍa with a monk as a companion messenger, and he asked Citta for forgiveness.
pli-tv-kd11:23.1.2: And he conducted himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released. He then went to the monks
pli-tv-kd11:23.1.5: The monks told the Buddha. He had the monks gathered and said,
pli-tv-kd11:23.1.6: “Well then, lift that legal procedure of reconciliation against Sudhamma.”

pli-tv-kd11:23.2.1: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of reconciliation against him should not be lifted:
pli-tv-kd11:23.2.2: he gives the full ordination; he gives formal support; he has a novice monk attend on him; he accepts being appointed as an instructor of the nuns; he instructs the nuns, whether appointed or not.
pli-tv-kd11:23.2.4: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of reconciliation against him should not be lifted:
pli-tv-kd11:23.2.5: he commits the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him; he commits an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him; he commits an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him;
pli-tv-kd11:23.2.6: he criticizes the procedure; he criticizes those who did the procedure.
pli-tv-kd11:23.2.8: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of reconciliation against him should not be lifted:

pli-tv-kd11:23.2.11: The group of eighteen on not to be lifted is finished.
